xxl.core.pipes.sinks
Class AbstractSink<I>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sinks.AbstractSink<I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node, Sink<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractTimeStampSink, DevNull, Printer, ResultCounterSink, SinkCursor, SWTSink.InternalSink, Tester, VisualSink
public abstract class AbstractSink<I>
extends AbstractNode
implements Sink<I>

Superclass for each kind of terminal sinks in a query graph. Abstract implementation of the interface Sink.

Since:
1.1

AbstractSink

public AbstractSink()
No subscriptions will be performed.

Method Detail

process

public void process(I o,
                    int sourceID)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
This method will be called in the transfer method of each source this sink got subscribed to. The element to be transfered will be sent to this sink selecting it as the first parameter. The second parameter specifies the ID this sink used during its subscription. Therefore the ID determines from which source this elements is from.
The element should not be cloned, if it is transfered to multiple sinks, which have been registered by a source. Due to performance reasons this source should rather use the same element and pass it to all subscribed sinks based on the assumption that these sinks will not perform any changes on this element, unless they clone it themselves.
The implementation consumes the element and updates metadata information. Furthermore, it calls the abstract method processObject in order to process the incoming object.

Specified by:
process in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
sourceID - One of the IDs this pipe specified during its subscription by the underlying sources.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

processObject

public abstract void processObject(I o,
                                   int sourceID)
                            throws IllegalArgumentException
This method has to be overwritten to process each incoming element. Its execution is considered to be atomar.

Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - One of the IDs this pipe specified during its subscription by the underlying sources.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

updateDoneStatus

protected void updateDoneStatus(int sourceID)
Sets the status isDone of the source with the given ID to true. If all sources are done, the 'global' isDone is set to true.

Parameters:
sourceID - ID of the source

getSource

public Source<? extends I> getSource(int index)
                              throws SinkIsDoneException,
                                     IllegalArgumentException,
                                     IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns a reference to the source belonging to the specified index, i.e., the index which was returned for this source when the method addSource was called.
The index corresponds to the source's position in the internal stored array of sources this sink got subscribed to.

Specified by:
getSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
index - The index used to access sources in the internal array of this sink.
Returns:
The source belonging to the specified index.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If no sources have been added.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index does not exist.

getSourceID

public int getSourceID(Source<? extends I> source)
                throws SinkIsDoneException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
Returns the first matching ID this sink used during its subscription by the specified source. This ID has already been stored, when the addSource method was invoked.
A linear pass through the interal source array is performed to determine the position of the first matching source. This position is used to access the internal ID array, because during a subscription both arrays are updated at the same position.

Specified by:
getSourceID in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscribed to.
Returns:
The ID this sink specified during its subscription.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified source has not been added.

getNoOfSources

public int getNoOfSources()
                   throws SinkIsDoneException
Returns the number of sources that are currently connected with this sink.
The length of the internal source array is returned.

Specified by:
getNoOfSources in interface Sink<I>
Returns:
The number of sources.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

addSource

public boolean addSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                         int sourceID)
                  throws SinkIsDoneException
Similar to the subscribe method of a source, this method establishes a connection between this sink and a source during runtime. The intention of both methods is to build up a double-linked query graph, which is completely navigatable.
The method should be used to store a reference to the given underlying source together with the sourceID specified during this sink's subscription.
The source and the ID used during subscription are stored in internal arrays. Their positions in both arrays are equal.

Specified by:
addSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscriped to.
sourceID - The ID this sinks used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the remove operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

removeSource

public boolean removeSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                            int sourceID)
                     throws SinkIsDoneException
In conformity to the unsubscribe method of a source, this method removes the connection between this sink and a source on the sink's side. Therefore it removes the given source with sourceID sourceID from the internal arrays used to store this sink's references to its sources.

Specified by:
removeSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscriped to.
sourceID - The sourceID this sinks used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the remove operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
